data.decision: Always follow the design workflow: Style guide → Moodboard/Direction exploration → Mockups with assets → User approval → Implementation. Never jump straight to code.
data.rationale: Jumping straight to code produces generic, forgettable designs. Following the design-first workflow with style guides, multiple directions, and proper mockups produces distinctive, memorable work with the "wow factor". The comparison between Direction A/B (generic) and Direction C (cosmic futurism) proved this - proper workflow yields better creative output.
data.context: TecArc agency website project - user requested comparison of code-first vs design-first approaches
